alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 24 at 1:22PM PDT until March 25 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT SATURDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Areas of central Douglas County above 1500 feet, including the passes on I-5 between Glendale and Canyonville, Highway 42 near Camas Mountain, and portions of Highway 227 from Tiller southward. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the commute this evening and Friday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Roads will remain wet in snow showers into this evening. The best chance for snow to accumulate on roads will be during the night, especially in heavier showers after midnight tonight until 9 AM PDT Saturday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
